intro: Xerotes drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale green berries that are toxic to most animals. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Xerotes drummondii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain birds and insects.
